life_date: American (Alfred, New York and Houston, Minnesota), born 1960
dimension: H.8-1/8 x W.5-7/8 x 4-5/8 in., overall
title: Covered ewer and bowl
text: Recently Sikora has been experimenting with the use of unglazed porcelain ewers with accompanying stands. The form of the ewers derives from Korean and Middle Eastern metal and ceramic ewers used for wine and oil. The white surfaces of the ewer and stand are gently colored by the salt and ash added during the firing. The pierced stands, also decorated with applied and carved motifs relieve the pristine surfaces.
description: cream glaze; round bodied ewer, circular bowl with square walls and open-work design; banding at rim and foot of bowl and ribbed ribbon handles at either side
